title: Authors and Citation
text: Thériault R (2025). pubDashboard: Creating Publication Data Visualization Dashboards. R package version 0.0.1, https://github.com/rempsyc/pubDashboard.
code: @Manual{,   title = {pubDashboard: Creating Publication Data Visualization Dashboards},   author = {Rémi Thériault},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://github.com/rempsyc/pubDashboard}, }

title: Creating Publication Data Visualization Dashboards
text: goal pubDashboard facilitate creation pretty data visualization dashboards using flexdashboard openalexR packages.

title: Creating Publication Data Visualization Dashboards
text: can install development version pubDashboard like :
code: # If `remotes` isn't installed, use `install.packages("remotes")` remotes::install_github("rempsyc/pubDashboard")

title: Creating Publication Data Visualization Dashboards
text: full source-code dashboards available corresponding button top-right dashboard.

what: Downloads relevant publication data using openalexR — fetch_openalex_pubs
title: Downloads relevant publication data using openalexR — fetch_openalex_pubs
text: Downloads relevant publication data using openalexR

title: Downloads relevant publication data using openalexR — fetch_openalex_pubs
code: fetch_openalex_pubs(   journal_name = NULL,   journal_id = NULL,   clean_journals_continents = FALSE,   progress_bar = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )

title: Downloads relevant publication data using openalexR — fetch_openalex_pubs
text: journal_name list desired journals (journal name). journal_id list desired journals (OpenAlex ID). clean_journals_continents Logical, whether also process dataframe clean_journals_continents function. set FALSE default large datasets can time consuming. progress_bar Logical, whether print progress bar. verbose Passed openalexR::oa_fetch() defaults TRUE. ... Arguments passed openalexR::oa_fetch()

title: Downloads relevant publication data using openalexR — fetch_openalex_pubs
text: recommended authors openalexR package, go , highly recommend set openalexR.mailto option requests go polite pool faster response times. OpenAlex Premium, can add API key openalexR.apikey option well. lines best go .Rprofile file.edit("~/.Rprofile").
code: options(openalexR.mailto = "example@email.com") options(openalexR.apikey = "EXAMPLE_APIKEY")"

title: Downloads relevant publication data using openalexR — fetch_openalex_pubs
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ x <- fetch_openalex_pubs(journal_name = "Collabra",   pages = 1, per_page = 1, publication_year = 2024) names(x) # Same as: x <- fetch_openalex_pubs(journal_id = "S4210175756",   pages = 1, per_page = 1, publication_year = 2024) names(x) } # }

title: Loop fetch_openalex_pubs over journals or years — lapply_fetch_openalex_pubs
text: years Desired list loop (option = "year"). journal_id list desired journals (OpenAlex ID). Looping . Options "year" "journal". from_publication_date Start date (option = "journal"). save Whether save data disk. file_suffix suffix add file (e.g., "_new"). verbose Passed openalexR::oa_fetch() defaults TRUE. ... Arguments passed openalexR::oa_fetch()

title: Loop fetch_openalex_pubs over journals or years — lapply_fetch_openalex_pubs
text: recommended authors openalexR package, go , highly recommend set openalexR.mailto option requests go polite pool faster response times. OpenAlex Premium, can add API key openalexR.apikey option well. lines best go .Rprofile file.edit("~/.Rprofile").
code: options(openalexR.mailto = "example@email.com") options(openalexR.apikey = "EXAMPLE_APIKEY")"

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ lapply_fetch_openalex_pubs(   over = "journal",   journal_id = c("https://openalex.org/S90392387",                  "https://openalex.org/S33443600"),  from_publication_date = "2024-01-01",  to_publication_date = "2024-10-15",  save = FALSE) } # }

title: Render complete pubDashboard dashboard — render_dashboard
text: Render complete pubDashboard dashboard

title: Render complete pubDashboard dashboard — render_dashboard
code: render_dashboard(   file_name = "dashboard",   title = "title",   author = "author",   journal_name = NULL,   journal_id = NULL,   data_folder = "data",   tab_continent = TRUE,   tab_continent_year = TRUE,   tab_continent_journal = TRUE,   tab_country = TRUE,   tab_country_journal = TRUE,   tab_psychology = FALSE,   tab_economics = FALSE,   tab_general = FALSE,   tab_figure1 = FALSE,   tab_missing = TRUE,   ... )

title: Render complete pubDashboard dashboard — render_dashboard
text: file_name Desired file name. title Desired dashboard title. author Desired displayed dashboard author. journal_name list desired journals (journal name). journal_id list desired journals (OpenAlex ID). data_folder Folder save data. tab_continent Whether render "Continent" tab. tab_continent_year Whether render "Continent year" tab. tab_continent_journal Whether render "Continent journal" tab. tab_country Whether render "Country" tab. tab_country_journal Whether render "Country journal" tab. tab_psychology Whether render "Psychology" tab. tab_economics Whether render "Economics" tab. tab_general Whether render "General" tab. tab_figure1 Whether render "Figure 1" tab. tab_missing Whether render "Missing" tab. ... Arguments passed openalexR::oa_fetch()

title: Render complete pubDashboard dashboard — render_dashboard
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ render_dashboard(   file_name = "my_dashboard",   title = "Wonderful Dashboard",   author = "Rémi Thériault",   journal_name = c("Journal of Personality and Social Psychology", "Health Psychology"),   from_publication_date = "2024-01-01",   tab_figure1 = TRUE ) } # }

title: Generate table of journal paper percentages, by continent and year — scatter_continent_year
text: data processed dataframe data method method use regression line, either "lm" (default) "loess" ymin Minimum value y-axis ymax Maximum value y-axis yby Tick increments y-axis plotly Logical, whether use plotly dynamic data visualization citation Optionally, citation add footer citation_size Font size citation text_size Size element_text ggplot2 element height Height argument plotly::ggplotly data_formatted save time, possible reuse dataframe used function generated table_continent_year(). ... arguments passed rempsyc::nice_scatter
